meanings.definition: The state or fact of living or existing together in the same place.
meanings.sent1: In the small village, the cohabitations of families created a strong sense of community.
meanings.sent2: The cohabitations of different species in the forest show the interconnectedness of nature.
meanings.sent3: The cohabitations of ants and beetles in the garden led to some interesting interactions.
meanings.sent4: The cohabitations of colors in the painting produced a vibrant and harmonious composition.
meanings.sent5: The cohabitations of flavors in the dish created a delicious blend of tastes.

meanings.definition: The act of living together as a married couple without being legally married.
meanings.sent1: Their cohabitations before marriage allowed them to understand each other better.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, cohabitations are common before formal marriage ceremonies.
meanings.sent3: The cohabitations of the fictional characters added a humorous twist to the story.
meanings.sent4: The cohabitations of melodies and lyrics in the song conveyed deep emotions.
meanings.sent5: Their cohabitations in the same apartment made their bond even stronger.
